title: Outside the delivery room
content:
When the fine hour strikes,
All the worldly sensations shrink
Into the moments that pass between
A dark roast drip,
Thoughts waiting at synapses, and
Language(s) rushing to aid,
A developing fetus of expression

title: Fearless hour
content:
The lights are dim, the hour late,
And you have followed me into this hour
When my words are loose and unkept
Not with the slightest inclination to converse
The lights are dim, the hour late,
So I will smear any makeup and
dance loud and alone
on the thin line
Ugly, mad, sane and beautiful
All the same

title: First approach in a perceptive field
content:
I feel somewhat 'easy' around perceptive people, as if they have played out the possibilities of themselves in different scenarios, so it feels safe to assume that there is nothing you could do to catch them completely off guard
As B, I see this as a fuzzy flexible field of A that enables B to advance easily (in approaching to establish a relationship)

title: Crystallizing into words
content: I feel thinking in words (in writing) puts you face to face with a voice that becomes recognizably yours!

title: Soft notes from good conversations
content:
Some form of joy is playing a fast sampling game with long questions and interrupted answers, autocompleting sentences, hurriedly skipping to the next and to next next, making a spontaneous detour to five questions ago, and already rushing to meet the other at the next junction in the
conversation

title: Never admire quietly
content:
"If I admire something about someone, I tell them. We humans are so fragile. It's important we give people their flowers while they are still here. Never admire quietly" - Chimamanda Adichie

I have tried my best to abide by this very honestly as a sincere attempt to bring out more of the things I admire into the world. (I urge you to too!)
Fragile is not the word, blindedness is more like it - I feel "peculiarly good"/"different" is a quality hard to admit to oneself when it comes instinctively to the person but is not recognizably rare as such.
There's a reach/field of view different sets of people can be bound to, honest admiration affords
them your eyes and attention that have probably seen a completely different world than them. It can be empowering when such feedback allows the person to apply the right self corrective in the right direction!

title: Self-realization as a rendezvous with self-ghost
content:
Those moments when I felt most alive, I remember feeling paralyzed, as if struck by lightning in the
middle of a storm of unnatural events that conjured around me all of a sudden.
I like to imagine that in that split second, I was nudged to pause and smile back at someone I had known but long forgotten.

title: Ticket to a secure life
content:
Something about a puzzle or a riddle is deeply satisfying and comforting. Just because it already
begins with a reassurance that a solution exists.
And when a solution exists, people run and chase to solve this puzzle because a solution exists. Seems rather funny if you think about it. But also makes sense?
If a predefined slot machine of this puzzle with finite giveaways is working well for long enough, it is logical to leave the worrying to someone else with some foresight to tell when to go do something else, like finding another slot machine? What if there won't be a slot machine anymore? What if an entire army evolves into being incapable of solving almost everything except the puzzle (just because a slot machine happened to be)
Like a bacterial population selected to survive over generations with great fitness in this neatly
prescribed rich broth, until one day someone messed up a few ions in the broth and half the species just disappeared

title: Discipline that holds you by the finger
content:
In stumbles, steps, strides and sprints
The discipline that holds you by the
finger
And forges the stoic fortitude

title: Delusional
content:
To watch
What awaits
And unfolds
In definite, indefinite time
Like staring into the abyss of a river
Knowing and unknowing
Each moment a beckoning truth
What is to ever surface, from whatever
that ever changes
In the infinite depth of the bottomless
river

title: Living way far away from reality
content:
I have imagined this many a times just HOW impossible it seemed to me, how I could ever brings things I wanted to reality (truly nobody does until they do)
An agentic kiddo version of me would have known that objects that fly across the sky are things that humans like her build from scratch (and there was a time when they didn't, and then there was an order of things that fell in place over time) and that they could do it again and again and again much better, not just when the newspapers cared to mention it, and that we understood all of it from scratch and could change it the way we wanted it to.
And that you can't go out in the world and plant a seed of this object just because it made sense to you. That it's just a seed without knowing how to tend it AND that nobody does and most don't care. So you go out hunting, collecting all obscure skills in a bag, and gather an obscure army of others to help you do just that.
That's how some times things as big and as real as what we see come to be.

title: Friendships, lenses, bookmarks
content:
Friendships as lenses to look at the world in finer details, as a means to bring new things to
wonder, reason and scrutiny, as living remote bookmarks to those thoughts evoked by otherwise mute objects

title: Hush, let the thousand flowers sing
content:
Learning to hold words with a little extra room for delight, 
to let the thousand flowers, sing more profoundly in them
In such a way as to not impose my rendition 
of melody or joy or anything mine
I think it can bring a certain sadness in branding your joy as something that only you can afford
When it's easy and bad enough already to be convinced that joy comes in recognizably dogmatic shades of red, blue and green

title: Off-balance
content:
The endless little imaginary stories
That creep up involuntarily
Like creepers climbing all over
Your neatly laid garden
When someone comes
And clips off a leaf.
It is then that you ought to look at the sun
And all that is brought to life
Again and again
Under its warm lasting light

title: Imprudent
content:
I wish to not measure
With a tape
Every inch and corner
Of my living life
To forge into
Pristine preciseness.
Although,
I do measure
As I experiment
Make and break
A protocol
And let the poet
Do the rest.

title: Narration that took me by surprise
content:
Depending on who you are,
I can tell the same story
effortlessly when the words themselves wouldn't weigh
too much
or
thoughtfully when the words would quickly adjust
themselves to my perception of your reception
or
excitedly when the words would race to the edge of my
lips and quickly escalate to something exquisite
And I will remember you
By the story you conjured out of me

title: Somewhere really close to your heart
content:
If you have never heard of it,
I will never pass up an opportunity,
To tell you that something, knowing that
That could have possibly changed
the entire trajectory of your life.
(because I believe it would)
(and just what are the odds!)
Like I almost owe it to you,
And how I would wrong the Universe,
And you, if I didn't
I ought to place such a beautiful thing,
Somewhere really close to your heart
(You see, it's only fitting)

title: Invitation to think
content: In retrospect, I feel the best conversations I have had were almost always based on questions that felt like an invitation to think.

title: Museum of memories (MoMemo)
content: Walking through places as a free ticket to cherished memories :)
